column4: hey, say if I had two drives, C and M. say if I had windows installed on C, and M formatted for windows, if I wiped C and installed ubuntu on it, would I need to reformat M to see it inside Ubuntu?
What are you trying to do?
I'm not entirely sure. I've been told to "grep your configuration files for RedirectMatch ^/$" and by configuration files, he's talking about Apache configuration files...
I am not sure what whoever told you that meant by the "^/$" at the end because it doesn't make sense as part of a regular expression
no idea. his mind moves in mysterious ways
What are you trying to do?
get my apache server to work properly
What about it is not working?
I get an "It works!" message instead of my index.html file..
If you run "sudo invoke-rc.d apache2 stop" do you still see "It works!" or do you get an error that it couldn't connect?
Then there is another another apache running somewhere, if you aren't connecting to localhost then it may be another computer
I can guarentee no other computer on my network is running Apache.
Is this a fresh install of apache?
Actually, it was probably the browser cache the entire time
